extendedIngredients.name: fresh basil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons minced fresh basil or 2 teaspoons dried basil

extendedIngredients.name: fresh parsley
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons minced fresh parsley or 1 tablespoon dried parsley flakes

extendedIngredients.name: fresh rosemary
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-1/2 teaspoons minced fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed

extendedIngredients.name: fresh thyme
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons minced fresh thyme or 2 teaspoons dried thyme

recipes.title: Hamburger Garden Soup
recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large saucepan, cook the beef, onion and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Add the remaining ingredients; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes to allow flavors to blend.                                        Yield: 5 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Hamburger Garden Soup in  Taste of Home Ground Beef Cookbook1999, p145                                                                                                                                                                                                       Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 each) equals 242 calories, 9 g fat (4 g saturated fat), 44 mg cholesterol, 745 mg sodium, 23 g carbohydrate, 5 g fiber, 20 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large saucepan, cook the beef, onion and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Add the remaining ingredients; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes to allow flavors to blend.
